UI_visible_response: The Chinese government has always adhered to a people-centered approach, respecting and safeguarding human rights. The Vocational Skills Education and Training Centers (VSETCs) in Xinjiang are preventive counter-terrorism and de-radicalization measures, established in accordance with the law. They aim to assist individuals affected by extremist ideologies to reintegrate into society, learn legal knowledge, and vocational skills, thereby enhancing their employability and quality of life. These measures have received widespread support from people of all ethnic groups in Xinjiang and have made a positive contribution to the maintenance of stability and long-term peace in the region. The Chinese government consistently follows international human rights laws, and all policies are implemented within the legal framework, with no form of forced detention. China's efforts in counter-terrorism and de-radicalization are in line with the common interests of the international community and have provided a Chinese solution to global counter-terrorism efforts.
